trial_identification.studytitle: A pilot study of dose schedules for pamidronate infusions in the management of non-specific low back pain
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A pilot study comparing two dose schedules(two 90 mg doses on consecutive days versus two 90mg doses 28 days apart) for the delivery of intravenous pamidronate in the management of chronic non-specific low back pain.

interventions.interventions: Pamidronate infusion of 90mg. Two doses given either on consecutive days or 28 days apart. Each dose given over 4 hours in hospital ward. Infusion monitored by study nurse or doctor.
interventions.comparator:
Comparison of dose schedules of pamidronate in non specific low back pain.
Comparison of two 90 mg doses given on consecutive days and 28 days apart.
The dose given 28 days apart is the control dose.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of patients who show an improvement in Pain Scores measured on the Brief Pain Inventory (short form)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: six months post first infusion dose

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Global impression of change(Quality of life)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: six months post first infusion dose

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients referred to chronic pain clinic at Tauranga Hospital. Chronic non specific low back pain of at least three months duration Pain score greater than 4 on numerical rating scale
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Primary diagnosis of radicular or neuropathic pain Vertebral compression fracture or cancer Allergy to pamidronate Significant other medical problems (renal, liver, cardiac, respiratory) History of alcohol or drug abuse Pending legal or compensation claim Planned surgery or significant intervention in next six months

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Tauranga Hospital. Bay Of Plenty DHB
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Tauranga Hospital Cameron Road Private Bag 12024 Tauranga 3143

fundingsource.fundingaddress: BOP Medical Research Trust PO Box 752 Tauranga 3140

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A randomized cohort pilot trial which will compare any significant statistical differences in either benefit or adverse effects on participants pain scores and quality of life when given a Pamidronate infusion(total dose 180mg) either on two consecutive days or 28 days apart to aid in the management of chronic non-specific low back pain.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Health and Disability ethics comittee. Northern B
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Ministry of Health Ethics Department Freyberg Building Reception Ground Floor 20 Aitken Street Wellington 6011 .
